data.title: Two U.S. Big Tech antitrust bills backed by publisher trade group
data.text: A group representing publishers such as News Corp and National Public Radio wrote to leaders of the Senate Judiciary Committee on Thursday to back two bills targeting Big Tech including one that would open up smartphone app stores to more competition.

data.title: Meta Promotes Nick Clegg to Chief Role
data.text: Meta has promoted Nick Clegg — its former global affairs vice president and one-time deputy prime minister of Great Britain — to a new executive role that places him at the top of the corporate structure. Clegg, who joined Facebook in 2018, has been named to the new position of president of global affairs.

data.title: 2 Stocks I'm Never Selling
data.text: Thanks to a handful of key qualities, these two stocks are set up for long-lasting success.

data.title: Billionaire investor Dan Loeb says there's an epic $1 trillion opportunity in Amazon that the market is failing to see
data.text: In a private call with Third Point investors, Loeb put AWS' enterprise value above $1.5 trillion and its core retail business at $1 trillion, the WSJ reported.

data.title: Apple's Face ID will soon work when you're wearing a mask. We put it to the test
data.text: Apple will soon allow iPhone users to unlock, sign in and pay with their faces even if they're wearing a mask. But how well does it really work? CNN Business' Samantha Kelly puts it to the test.

data.title: Google's self-driving truck project is teaming up with a logistics company to carry deliveries down a 240-mile Texas road
data.text: The partnership will combine Waymo Via's autonomous truck technology with C.H. Robinson's network of almost 200,000 shippers and carriers.

data.title: Amazon Faces More Union Votes With NY in March
data.text: Amazon workers at a Staten Island warehouse will vote next month on whether to form a union, Christian Smalls, the organization's president and former employee tweeted Wednesday (Feb 16). The Amazon Labor Union (ALU) said it has agreed with the eCommerce powerhouse to hold an on-site election from March 25 through March 30.

data.title: Amazon's Outlook Is 'Bright.' Dan Loeb Is Buying More of the Stock.
data.text: The activist investor sees around $1 trillion in untapped value in Amazon. The stock is at a 30%-40% discount to its present intrinsic value, he wrote.

data.title: Salesforce teams with AWS on direct-to-consumer streaming media solution
data.text: Running a streaming media service requires a complex combination of technologies that can be difficult for even large companies to manage on their own. The Salesforce and AWS media industry groups have come together in an attempt to simplify that process by offering a solution that combines an infrastructure solution from AWS and marketing and […]

data.title: Amazon and Visa resolve dispute over credit card fees
data.text: Online retailer will continue to accept Visa payments across its sites after striking global deal

data.title: New Strong Buy Stocks for February 17th
data.text: ARCB, AAPL, COWN, FELE, and DHI have been added to the Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) List on February 17, 2022.

data.title: Will RFID Help Loosen Amazon's Grip On Retail?
data.text: RFID's continued proliferation into categories beyond Apparel and Footwear is bad news for Amazon. But the longer it takes retailers to fix the inventory management issues in their stores, the longer Amazon will keep laughing all the way to the bank.

data.title: Amazon reaches deal to continue accepting Visa payments worldwide
data.text: Amazon and Visa have resolved their simmering dispute over payment fees in the UK and elsewhere, Reuters has reported. Amazon threatened to stop accepting Visa in the UK starting January 19.

data.title: 2 Top Bargain Stocks Ready for a Bull Run
data.text: The market has failed to appreciate the growth in these two tech giants.

data.title: How Google's Privacy Solution Will Impact Magnite, Digital Turbine, Trade Desk As Per Analysts
data.text: Alphabet Inc's (NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) Google has announced Privacy Sandbox, a multi-year initiative to build more private advertising solutions.  Google said these solutions will "limit sharing of user data with third parties and operate without cross-app identifiers, including advertising ID.

data.title: Here's Why Activist investor Daniel Loeb Sees ~$1T Untapped Value In Amazon
data.text: The Wall Street Journal reports that activist investor Daniel Loeb sees ~$1 trillion in untapped value at Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ: AMZN). Loeb's Third Point LLC counts the e-commerce major as one of its most significant holdings.

data.title: Visa and Amazon Strike Global Deal Ending Card Fee Dispute
data.text: Amazon and Visa have reached a global agreement ending a several months-long dispute over rising card fees, both companies said in statements on Thursday (Feb. 17). There will no longer be a surcharge fee to use a Visa credit card in Australia and Singapore.

data.title: Britain's former deputy prime minister is now one of the most powerful people at Meta
data.text: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has tasked Nick Clegg with leading Meta on "all policy matters" around the world.

data.title: After an Explosive Q4, What Could Possibly Stop Apple?
data.text: What the tech titan needs to do to keep up its record-breaking run.

data.title: 2 Reasons I Wouldn't Hesitate to Buy Netflix Stock Right Now
data.text: There is a clear path for the streaming leader to significantly grow subscribers.
